DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Study Procedure Lost Clean Cloth Packet Occurrence Four Digit Integer
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of lost or discarded packets or bundle of cleaning cloths, a fabric used to wipe away dirt or contamination, as a defined procedure of a clinical study, a type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Study Procedure Lost Clean Cloth Packet Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the lost or discarded cleaning cloth, a fabric used to wipe away dirt or contamination, as a defined procedure of a clinical study, a type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. :Any stepwise set of actions.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

Property.preferredDefinition: Lost; parted with; no longer held or possessed.:The action of removing dirt, filth, or unwanted substances from.:Material formed by weaving, knitting, felting, or pressing fibers together.:An envelope into which only one dose of a drug product, usually in the form of granules or powder, has been directly placed. An example includes glassine powder paper containing aspirin. Other examples include aluminum foil packets into which alcohol swabs and pledgets are placed.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: Parted with; no longer held or possessed; incapable of being recovered or regained.
The action of removing dirt, filth, or unwanted substances from.
Material formed by weaving, knitting, felting, or pressing fibers together.

An envelope into which only one dose of a drug product, usually in the form of granules or powder, has been directly placed. An example includes glassine powder paper containing aspirin. Other examples include aluminum foil packets into which alcohol swabs and pledgets are placed.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to COG for by script Thu Jan 2 10:00:57 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part and up to four digits.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.:A single character in a numbering system.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.
A single character in a numbering system.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.

ValueDomain.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
ValueDomain.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to COG for by script Thu Jan 2 10:00:57 EST 2014
